summary:
What happens when you die? ‘World’s smartest man’ with ‘IQ higher than Einstein’ claims he has the answer

Date: Dec 19, 2024 08:41 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Chris Langan, known for his high IQ, shares his views on death and existence. He believes that death may not be the end, suggesting a continuity into another dimension.

  • Langan claims that reality is a self-simulation and developed the Cognitive-Theoretic Model of the Universe (CTMU).
  • He discusses the concept of death as a transition rather than an end, implying a shift to another dimension.
  • According to him, one may forget their previous life after this transition due to being in a state of meditation.
“Death might be a shift in the ‘syntax’ of existence.” - Chris Langan

Langan posits that understanding death could reshape how humans perceive life after death, emphasizing the importance of not fearing it.
newTitle: Chris Langan's Perspective on Death: Insights from the ‘World’s Smartest Man’

summary:
Who was Rubi Patricia Vergara? Wisconsin school shooting victim, 14, was ‘an avid reader, loved art’

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The sad story of Rubi Patricia Vergara, a 14-year-old freshman who was killed in a shooting at Abundant Life Christian School in Madison, Wisconsin, has emerged. She was remembered for her love of reading, art, and music.

  • Rubi was an avid reader and had a passion for art.
  • She participated in family worship, playing keyboard and singing.
  • Her family shared a special bond with her pets, Ginger the cat and Coco the dog.
  • Rubi was killed alongside a teacher, and six others were injured during the incident.
  • The funeral service will be held at City Church in Madison on December 21, 2024.
“This is our beautiful Rubi Vergara, our niece who was killed in Monday's school shooting...” - A family member reflecting on her tragic loss.

The tragic event highlights the ongoing concerns regarding school safety and the impact of such incidents on families and communities.

title: Indian Gets Jail Term In US For Trying To Engage Minor In Sex Act - NDTV
summary:
Indian National Sentenced for Attempting to Engage Minor in Sexual Act

Publication Date: July 27, 2019

Source: NDTV

Kirtan Patel, a 24-year-old Indian national, has pleaded guilty to attempting to entice a minor into sexual activity.

  • Patel communicated online with someone he thought was a 13-year-old girl.
  • The alleged minor was actually an undercover agent from Homeland Security Investigations.
  • He was arrested in Marion County when he arrived for a meeting.
  • Patel faces a minimum of 10 years up to life in federal prison.
“Ultimately, Patel was arrested when he travelled to a location in Marion County to engage in sexual activity with the child.” - US Attorney Roger B Handberg

This case highlights the ongoing efforts to combat online predatory behavior and ensure justice for potential victims.
newTitle: Indian National Sentenced for Attempting to Engage Minor in Sexual Act

  • SpaceX has denied allegations regarding Musk’s connections to Putin and any substance use.
  • Musk’s clearance allows access to certain Department of Defense facilities, but restricts him from viewing sensitive information.

Biden Administration Relaxes H-1B Visa Rules For American Companies: How Will It Help Indians? - News18
summary:
Biden Administration Eases H-1B Visa Regulations Benefiting Indian Professionals

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: News18

The outgoing Biden administration has relaxed H-1B visa rules, making it easier for American companies to hire foreign workers. This change is anticipated to significantly benefit Indian tech professionals.

  • The H-1B visa allows US companies to employ foreign workers in specialty occupations.
  • Changes include easing transitions from F-1 student visas to H-1B status.
  • The Department of Homeland Security aims to modernize definitions and criteria for special positions.
  • New flexibilities for F-1 students to maintain lawful status during the transition.
“American businesses rely on the H-1B visa programme for the recruitment of highly-skilled talent, benefiting communities across the country,” said Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas.

This rule represents a significant step toward addressing labor needs in the tech industry while ensuring compliance with US worker protections.
newTitle: Biden Administration Eases H-1B Visa Regulations Benefiting Indian Professionals

summary:
US President-elect Donald Trump's New Hairstyle Sparks Reactions Online

Date: November 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Former President Donald Trump, after emerging victorious in the 2024 presidential elections, is making headlines once again, this time for his new hairstyle, which has elicited a variety of reactions from netizens.

Here are a few reactions:

  • “The ultimate hat hair.”
  • “I'm going to shake his hand and tell him, thank you before I die. I absolutely believe he would change things for the better.”
  • “As long as it's still orange, we're fine.”
  • “Guess it would be what Melonia likes!!”
  • “He's also a fat slob....”
  • “Honestly, the haircut's the least of his problems. Maybe if he focused more on policies rather than his looks, we'd actually get somewhere.”
  • “It's like a mullet without the length and I kinda like it.”
  • “Balding doughboy.”

Trump achieved a significant electoral victory, securing 295 electoral votes against Kamala Harris’s 226. He is now the first leader in over a century to serve non-consecutive terms and the oldest person elected to office at the age of 78.
newTitle: US President-elect Donald Trump's New Hairstyle Sparks Reactions Online
